bug.short_desc: git-cola 2.9 is unusable, always hangs if maximized
bug.cf_doc_type: If docs needed, set a value

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem: git-cola 2.9 does not work at all for me. I get the directory selection prompt, and as soon as I select one, it hangs and I have to kill it. I had to downgrade to 2.8.
This is probably because I have git-cola maximized: https://github.com/git-cola/git-cola/issues/641 There is a fix in current master, please backport it ASAP, as your update made the package unusable.
Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable): git-cola-2.9-1.fc25
How reproducible: Always
Steps to Reproduce: 1. Have git-cola configured to be maximized. (I guess closing it once when maximized is sufficient. Otherwise, see the upstream bug for the configuration setting.) 2. Select a repository on startup.
Actual results: The process hangs without the UI ever even coming up.
Expected results: The UI comes up.
v2.10 was just released and contains the fix for this issue.

git-cola-2.10-1.el7 has been submitted as an update to Fedora EPEL 7. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-EPEL-2017-151cb7ad1c
Thanks Kevin for reporting the issue and sorry for the inconvenience. Can you please let me know if 2.10 fixes the issue for you?
Yes, it does, I tested it, and it works fine now, thanks!
